page.title: 13Woods Near Wickhambreaux.
page.content: { }Wenderton Hoath {*************** The most common tree is the {chestnut.}The other trees are{oak, ash and{hazel.}Some trees have been pulled down by{old man's beard}and{honey {suckle. In the spring when we first entered the wood it was very green. As we climbed the hill we found carpets of {bluebells}which smelt beautiful. There were patches of{celandines, ground ivy and{pink campions;}later in the year {bracken}grows over the ground. We saw an{adder}on a pile of leaves and bracken; when it saw us it stayed very still and then slithered away very, very slowly. We also saw a{slow- {worm,}which was at the side of the path in the shade, but when it heard us it moved away slowly.
